creator: don_sfw@dlaster.com
text:
When trying to compile httpd 2.0.54 with the latest openssl (0.9.8) the compile
failed complaining about PEM_F_DEF_CALLBACK.  The files that appear to be
specifically involved are

modules/ssl/ssl_engine_pphrase.c
modules/ssl/ssl_toolkit_compat.h

The definition PEM_F_DEF_CALLBACK appear to have been eliminated in openssl 0.9.8.

Everything compiles fine with openssl 0.9.7g.

And how would that be the httpd's project's issue, if you upgraded and
they've changed their API?


(hint: hold on for 2.0.55)
creator: wrowe@apache.org
